title: The Unbreakable Elizabeth Holmes
sub_head: Like the sitcom heroine, she’s innocent, more or less, and ready to move on.
body:
This isn’t the 1980s. We don’t all watch the same TV shows, so right off we must specify the headline is a reference to a Netflix sitcom.
In the frequently hilarious “Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt,” a 29-year-old woman from the Midwest, played by Ellie Kemper, has recently been freed after 15 years of living in an underground bunker, along with three other women, in a not fully explained relationship with a deranged pastor and doomsday cultist, played by the hunky Jon Hamm of “Mad Men” fame.
